snippet: The man accused of fatally shooting a 17-year-old in Jacksonville after an argument over loud music is now being charged with first-degree murder.
abstract: Charges against Michael Dunn, man accused of shooting 17-year-old Jordan Davis after an argument over loud music in Jacksonville, Fla, are upgraded from second-degree to first-degree murder; case is expected to become another high-profile test for Florida's broad self-defense laws.
lead_paragraph: The man accused of fatally shooting a 17-year-old in Jacksonville after an argument over loud music is now being charged with first-degree murder.

headline.seo: Charges Stepped Up in Florida Killing of Youth
headline.main: Murder Charges Upgraded in Florida Killing of Youth
headline.print_headline: Murder Charges Upgraded In Florida Killing of Youth
